listitem.para: Set the IKE socket buffer size. On Linux, this option uses SO_RCVBUFFORCE and SO_SNDBUFFORCE so that it can override rmem_max/wmem_max values of the OS. This requires CAP_NET_ADMIN (which is also required for other tasks). This option can also be toggled on a running system using ipsec whack --ike-socket-bufsize bufsize.
The default is determined by the OS (as of writing, this seems to be 212992). On Linux this is visible via /proc/sys/net/core/rmem_default and /proc/sys/net/core/wmem_default.
